sections.heading: Reason for Referral
sections.content: Ms. Jane Doe is being referred for further evaluation and management of persistent fatigue, intermittent low-grade fevers, and unexplained weight loss over the past three months.

sections.heading: History of Present Illness
sections.content: The patient reports feeling increasingly tired over the last quarter, with episodes of mild fever and a gradual, unintentional weight loss of approximately 5 kg. She denies recent travel, sick contacts, or significant changes in her daily routine. There is no history of night sweats, cough, or gastrointestinal symptoms. Over-the-counter supplements and dietary changes have not improved her symptoms.

sections.heading: Relevant Medical History
sections.content: Ms. Doe has a history of mild asthma, controlled with as-needed inhalers. No known drug allergies. Surgical history is unremarkable. Family history is notable for type 2 diabetes in her mother.

sections.heading: Examination Findings
sections.content: On examination, the patient appears mildly pale but is not in acute distress. Vital signs are within normal limits. No lymphadenopathy or organomegaly is detected. Cardiovascular, respiratory, and abdominal exams are unremarkable.

sections.heading: Investigations to Date
sections.content: Recent blood work revealed mild normocytic anemia (Hb 10.8 g/dL), normal white cell and platelet counts, and slightly elevated ESR. Liver and renal function tests are within normal range. Chest X-ray is clear. No abnormalities detected on urinalysis.

sections.heading: Assessment
sections.content: Persistent unexplained fatigue and weight loss with mild anemia. No clear source of infection or malignancy identified thus far.

sections.heading: Plan and Recommendations
sections.content: Requesting comprehensive evaluation by the General Medicine team to investigate the underlying cause of her symptoms. Suggested further workup may include autoimmune panel, infectious disease screening, and possible referral to hematology if indicated. Please consider reviewing her current medications and supplement use. Thank you for your assessment and recommendations.
